intro: Tithymalus esula subsp. pseudocyparissias, commonly known as the purple tithymale, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, purple flowers. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from late spring to early summer. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
